final_answer.precision_note: Final concentration to 3 s.f. (limited by 0.200 mol dm-3 and 25.0 cm3).

method: Use the dilution relationship c1V1 = c2V2. The technician dilutes 25.0 cm3 of 0.200 mol dm-3 HCl to a final volume of 250.0 cm3, so the volume increases by a factor of 250.0/25.0 = 10. Therefore the concentration decreases by the same factor: c2 = c1 × (V1/V2) = 0.200 × (25.0/250.0) = 0.200 × 0.100 = 0.0200 mol dm-3. (The cm3 units cancel in the ratio V1/V2, so no separate cm3→dm3 conversion is required when using the ratio form.)
checks: A tenfold increase in volume should give a tenfold decrease in concentration.
0.200 mol dm-3 diluted to 10× volume gives 0.0200 mol dm-3, which is sensible.
